history.content: Hi there, this question is best asked to your ESS Adviser in Bechtel Hall. Based on the students' answer to @431 this may not be a possibility.

I wanted to do that as well but realized as an engineering student, that's not an option. However, why not take a class on letter grade instead? If you can't spare much time to do all the work, then taking the class isn't probably going to help you. If you do have an interest in the subject, you will probably do well. I feel that auditing is actually not a bad idea but most people auditing EECS classes end up not continuing. Anyways, I feel that not being able to take classes P/NP might be a blessing in disguise.

I'm currently a sophomore EECS major, and I'm wondering if I can take upper division CS courses P/NP. If I have all my course requirements (ie 45 units of engineering, etc.) satisfied, but I want to take extra CS classes for fun, can I take those extra classes P/NP? 
Can I similarly take upper division math classes, which I do not need for the EECS degree and am taking purely for pleasure, P/NP?
history.subject: P/NP Guidelines for technical courses
